page.title: 19DAD'S ARMY West Forres
page.content: During the Second World War a special unit of the Home Guard made use of an underground bunker near Forres Airfield.This unit was sent on exercises and some of the results were straight from 'Dad's Army'.One mission was aimed at capturing Forres Airfield and involved crossing the River Findhorn.A raft was constructed but the tow rope broke and unfortunately the crew drifted helplessly down the river.Another sortie was a surprise night raid on a nearby castle but this turned into a surprisingly noisy retreat when a bee hive was overturned.
